description: A pallet full of heavy mud bricks which need to dry slowly to be usable.

use_action.msg: You test the bricks, and they're solid enough to use.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The bricks are still too damp to bear weight.
use_action.//: Should be about a week. Irl it's ten days, so make big batches.

description: A pallet of humble mud bricks that have dried for a week, while you were out risking your life.  Disassemble it to retrieve your frame and building supplies.
This bulky device takes water and calcium carbide and yields unpressurised acetylene.
This widespread powertool is often used for removing excess material or polishing surfaces.
This is a manufactured disc for an angle grinder, with a thin abrasive edge designed for cutting metal.
This is a manufactured disc for an angle grinder, with a thick abrasive surface designed for grinding and shaping metal.
This is a portable charcoal-fired kiln.  It is designed for firing bricks, but you could use it to fire anything made of clay.
A pair of toothy wooden paddles used to clean fibers for use in textile production.
This is a homemade vacuum forming machine with an air pump.  It's used for creating plastic molds.
This is a portable vacuum forming machine with an air pump.  It's used for creating plastic molds.
A tool similar to a chisel, designed to remove paint.
This clamp is useful for keeping things still, especially if you have several of them.

This is a small prying tool with a clawed bend at one end for pulling spikes.  Use it to open locked doors without destroying them or to lift manhole covers.  You could also wield it to bash some heads in.
A portable concrete mixer.  It is still large and heavy, but it can be operated solo, and runs on batteries.  It also has a heater built in.
This is a cordless battery-powered drill with a selection of drill bits.

This is a cordless battery-powered impact wrench, designed to deliver high torque via an internal rotating hammer.  It comes with a standard set of sockets, and makes a loud ratcheting sound when it operates.  You could use it to turn large bolts, or even change a vehicle wheel.
//: Loosely based on DeWalt DCF899B 20V 1/2-inch cordless impact wrench, $220 on Amazon, 6.4 pounds.

description: A pair of specialized wooden rods used to spin fibers into thread and yarn.
This is a construction tool for drilling through hard rock or other surfaces.  It runs on a cell compatible with UPS.  Use it to blast a hole in adjacent solid terrain.
This is a sturdy saw, useful for cutting through metal objects.

This is a pair of tin snips, resembling a sturdy pair of scissors with beefy blades designed to cut through thin sheets of soft metal.  These cannot cut through thick metals like a hacksaw can, but are better suited to precision work and leave a cleaner edge.
//: Loosely based on Stanley FATMAX straight cut 9-7/8-inch aviation snip

description: This is a demagnetized steel claw hammer with a wooden grip.  With a hammer, nails, and planks in your inventory, you could board up adjacent doors and windows.  It has myriad other uses as well.
A primitive manual drill with a single drill bit.  It is slow and it will exhaust you quickly.
This is a flexible rubber hose.  It could be used for crafting, or siphoning fuel from a vehicle.
A portable hydraulic bottle jack used for lifting vehicles.
A poorly constructed improvised scissor jack used for lifting vehicles if you're brave enough to use it.
A compact scissor jack used for lifting vehicles.
This is a construction tool for drilling through hard rock or other surfaces.  It runs on gasoline.  Use it (if loaded) to blast a hole in adjacent solid terrain.

This is a portable electric kiln, powered by batteries.  It is designed for firing bricks, but you could use it to fire anything made of clay.  With a little mechanical know-how, you could probably even convert it to run directly off a vehicle's power system.
This is a complete toolkit made to repair damaged firearms.  Powered by standard batteries, it is a vital tool for long-term firearms maintenance.  It requires 25 charges of battery power per use.
This is a crude hammer made from a piece of metal affixed to a stick.  It functions adequately as a hammer, but really can't compare to a proper one.
These tools are commonly used to remove small amounts of materials from the surface of metal objects.
This metallic tool is most often used to smooth concrete, or mortar, in construction projects.

This is a portable toolkit, consisting of a small carving knife for precise carving of replacement parts from raw materials, a wood saw for more heavy-duty wood cutting, and a patch of soft material for cleaning surfaces.  If supplied with duct tape, it can be used to repair certain items.
This is a plastic mold.  It can be used to form plastic chunks.

//: The multitool is a bit more of a toolkit than a knife.
description: A cleverly designed all-in-one tool which combines several smaller tools into the handles of a pair of pliers.

A compact tool kit intended for welding and cutting metal, this portable oxyacetylene torch includes a torch handle and cutting attachment in an easy-to-carry tote.  It requires connecting to pressurized cylinders of an appropriate welding gas before use.  In addition to its metalworking uses, you can activate it in order to destroy metal barriers.
A wide brush, suitable for painting walls.
This is a large steel pickaxe, suitable for breaking up hard things or (with enough skill) hard targets.  Strike the earth!
A heavy-headed cast and worked tool with a pointed wedge on one side for breaking stone and flat wedge on the other for prying it out.  You could mine with this.
Handheld pin reamers of this kind are used to enlarge existing holes, or remove any burs and such from them.
This is a basic pair of slip-joint pliers, able to handle basic mechanical work.  Anything too complex will require a wrench.
This is a large pair of slip-joint pliers bent at the elbow, able to handle basic mechanical work.  Anything too complex will require a wrench.

These pliers have extra-hefty jaws, and an adjustable mechanism to clamp them in a locked grip on whatever unfortunate object is trapped between them.  They could grip and turn a fairly large bolt head, or clamp two parts together temporarily.
An electric polisher which can be used to buff metal surfaces until they are reflective like a mirror.
This is a rock affixed to a stick, in the crude facsimile of a hammer.  It functions adequately as a hammer, but really can't compare to a proper one, and can't pull out nails either.

This battery-powered tool, commonly known by the generic trademark Sawzall, uses an electric motor to push a straight sawblade back and forth to rapidly cut wood or metal.  It is useful for heavy demolition and construction work, but is poorly suited to precision tasks.
This is a heavy-duty bag marked with the Hub 01 logo.  It contains space for barrels, adapters, and proprietary tools.  Embossed on the inside is a sketch of the Hybrid Weapons Platform.
This is a Philips-head screwdriver.  It is important for almost all electronics crafting, most mechanics crafting, and has many more uses.
This is a set of screwdrivers in several sizes and blade types.  Guaranteed to have the right tools for more precise work.
This is a ratcheting screwdriver with a collection of hex sockets for turning small bolts or nuts, including a couple standard screwdriver bits.

This is a thick-handled ratchet wrench with an assortment of interchangeable sockets in common hex bolt sizes.  You could loosen or tighten fairly large bolts with this, and the ratchet makes a satisfying clicking sound.
//: Modeled after 40-piece Walmart set, 2.85 lb, case 9.75 x 1.5 x 5 inches

description: This is a portable toolkit made to repair damaged firearms.  Powered by standard batteries, it is a vital tool for long-term firearms maintenance.  It requires 100 charges of battery power per use.
This is a device with a metal tip that can get very hot.  It is necessary for advanced electronics crafting.  You could also use it to cauterize wounds, if you had to.

A steel rod bent 90 degrees with a socket on the shorter end, made to hold the lug nuts of a car's wheels to either fasten or loosen for convenient removal and replacement.  Makes for a decent melee weapon in a pinch.
This is a stout metal box for containing tools.  It has a handle on the top and a latch on the front.
This is a stout metal box for containing tools.  It is much bigger than a regular tool box and could be used to store more tools than usual.
Your multitool, extended.  Ready to do repair work.
//: Charges will exceed max charges since they're always equal to the player's bionic power, but this has no adverse effects.

description: This is a battery powered tool for welding metal pieces together using an electric arc.  It is an indispensable tool for construction or repair.

This crude arc welder has been fashioned from a few small transformers, some wire, improvised electrode holder and complete disregard for personal safety.  While it's not as efficient as a factory welder, it will serve in a pinch.
This large makeshift tool is used in smoothing concrete or mortar in construction projects.  You could also use it as an improvised head-basher.
The natural cluster of wool fibers.  Could be processed to the felt patches or yarns.

This is a small, sharp knife, designed for making precise cuts for textiles or crafts.  It could cause decent damage, but is difficult to hit things with it.  Its small, sharp blade allows for precision strikes in the hands of the skilled.  It is too small to butcher corpses with.
This adjustable crescent wrench is compact, with a short handle that fits in the palm of the hand.  It could be used for turning small hex-head nuts or bolts.
//: Measured weight of 6-inch Craftsman wrench with 150mm jaws, assume 8g/ml steel density plus some margin for mechanism and empty space.

description: This is an adjustable crescent wrench.  It could be a decent melee weapon, and is used in many mechanics crafting recipes.
This adjustable crescent wrench is unusually large, with a long handle and jaws that widen over two inches.  This could easily turn most bolts, and should even work on wheel lug nuts.
//: WESTWARD 31D018 from Walmart, 18-inch length, 2-3/8-inch jaws, 4.23 lb, assume 8g/ml steel density with some margin for mechanism and other empty space.

description: This is a hose made out of leather.  Watertight and flexible, it can be used to siphon fuel from a vehicle tank.  However, it's not as elastic as a rubber hose.
This is a makeshift manual drill made out of pipe and improvised drill bit.  It is very slow and it will exhaust you quickly.
A machine designed specifically for turning metal rods into wire.

A compact tool kit intended for cutting metal, this portable propane torch includes a torch handle and cutting attachment in an easy-to-carry tote.  It requires connecting to pressurized propane cylinders before use.  While not appropriate for welding, you can activate it in order to destroy metal barriers.
